intro: Meliosma philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine meliosma, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Philippines and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often with a fragrant aroma. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is typically found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native habitat.
